executive_summary: The popularity of dance as a medium for fitness, artistic expression and social interaction has kept the industry on an upward trajectory, despite setbacks in recent years. Dance studios have seen a remarkable rebound following the pandemic's disruptive impact. The forced closure of dance studios and the shift to virtual classes initially strained many businesses, but studios demonstrated resilience. By 2021 and 2022, amid relaxing stay-at-home orders and the return of in-person courses, studios experienced higher in-person attendance. The pent-up demand for in-studio practice compensated for previous losses and contributed to a resurgence in enrollment. Over the last few years, revenue has grown at a CAGR of 3.5% to $5.4 billion and will expand at 2.6% in 2024.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Virtual dance classes fueled revenue growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Virtual dance classes became the industry norm, breaking geographical barriers and enabling studios to reach a wider market. Dance instructors who were let go from studios could also continue to work from home.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Dance studios see enrollment spike from kids, teens and adults
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Studios saw a revenue spike in 2021 and 2022 once dancers could return to in-person classes. The pent-up demand generated from new and returning dance students more than compensated for the previous year's losses.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Dance trends on social media motivate new students to sign up
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Dancing is growing in popularity, thanks mainly to the influence of social media. This is particularly evident with TikTok, where many of the platform's most popular creators are skilled dancers and choreographers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Live performance and a creative community will inspire adult hobbyist dancers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Greater disposable income and leisure time will boost recreational spending. More consumers will be able to afford to invest in their artistic endeavors, inflating enrollment in dance programs.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Hybrid classes and tech innovations shape studio offerings
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Dance studios will continue to have virtual classes as a standard offering. A hybrid approach allows students from various locations to participate, broadening the reach and providing greater flexibility for students and instructors.

industry_definition: This industry includes studios that primarily offer instructional classes focused on providing knowledge and skills related to dance. This includes but is not limited to, ballroom dancing, ballet, hip-hop and modern dance. These include dance schools for children, intermediate-level and professional dancers. This industry does not include dance companies.

opportunities: High Performance Drivers: Total recreation expenditure
threats: Time spent on leisure and sports

key_trends: Students have a lot of power when choosing dance studios. With numerous options and substitutes available, studios must maintain an excellent reputation and competitive pricing to attract and retain members.
The dance studio market is highly localized. Most students prefer convenience and won't relocate for a dance school, leading to market fragmentation.

TikTok, Instagram and similar platforms entice young people to sign up for dance lessons. These social media platforms serve as crucial marketing tools for studios, which can participate in dance trends to inspire online youth to enroll in classes.

Dance studios will capitalize on rising health consciousness among consumers. By blending strength training and aerobic exercise with dance, studios will increasingly offer holistic wellness classes to attract and retain students from the fitness market.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Many parents enroll preschool-aged children in beginner ballet classes, which most dance studios offer.
Children in this age group take dance classes for social and physical development.
Health-conscious adults are becoming increasingly interested in dance classes, though this segment competes with non-industry dance classes hosted by gyms or sports clubs.

products_and_services.product_description: Ballet classes offered by dance studios.
Classes teaching various dance styles like tap, hip hop, jazz etc.

tier_1_suppliers: Athletic & Sporting Goods Manufacturing in the US
Gym & Exercise Equipment Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Men's & Boys' Apparel Wholesaling in the US
tier_1_buyers: Live Performance Theaters in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Higher per capita disposable income boosts dance studio enrollment by increasing the public's ability to spend on discretionary activities, like dance classes.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast hosts over a quarter of the US population, making it the most popular region for dance studios.

Metropolitan areas with a high population density and a strong interest in the arts host more dance studios. California leads the industry, benefiting from the largest population in the U.S. and major cities like Los Angeles, San Francisco and San Diego.

regulations_points.regulation_description: State and federal laws govern membership contracts for dance studios.

barriers_points.barrier_description: New dance studios can find it challenging to navigate local zoning regulations.

basis_points.basis_title: Students have a lot of power when choosing dance studios
basis_points.basis_description: With numerous options and substitutes available, studios must maintain an excellent reputation and competitive pricing to attract and retain members.

concentration_points.concentration_title: A LOCALIZED MARKET LEADS TO FRAGMENTATION
concentration_points.concentration_description: Students looking to join a dance studio choose options nearby that are convenient for them.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Other Costs Include Rentals and Insurance
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Dance studios are legally required to maintain a certain level of insurance coverage.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Attracting and retaining qualified dance instructors is challenging.

FAQs.question: What efforts has your company made to build a following on social media outlets such as Instagram?
FAQs.answer: Recognition plays a key role in helping a studio attract students.
